description: Numerators in expansion of a certain Dirichlet series.
comments: a(n) is also the number of orbits of length n for the map SxT where S has one orbit of each length and T has one orbit of each odd length. [From Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Apr 08 2009]
links: M. Baake and R. V. Moody, Similarity submodules and semigroups in Quasicrystals and Discrete Geometry, ed. J. Patera, Fields Institute Monographs, vol. 10 AMS, Providence, RI (1998) pp. 1-13.
A. Pakapongpun, T. Ward, Functorial Orbit counting, JIS 12 (2009) 09.2.4, example 17.
formula: zeta(s)*Product((1+p^-s)/(1-p^(1-s))), p>2.a(n)=(1/n)sumdiv(n,d,mu(n/d)sum(d,e,e)sum(d,e odd only,e) [From Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Apr 08 2009]
mathematica: a[n_] := (1/n)*DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[n/#]*DivisorSigma[1, #]*DivisorSum[ #, If[OddQ[#], #, 0]&]&]; Array[a, 80] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 07 2015, adapted from PARI *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
